ygData.subject: Re: Crawler running with less than configured threads.
ygData.msgSnippet: Thanks for your response Gordon. ... I think you are correct about feeding URIs into the crawler. When I am converting the diverted files to .schedule format,

Thanks for your response Gordon.

On 1/8/2012 2:58 PM, Gordon Mohr wrote:

> None of the WARNINGs are likely related to the thread-death issue,
> though the about 'politessDelay unset' [sic] is a bit perplexing for
> other reasons, and the one at "2011-12-28 18:02:57.554" about a "Problem
> line" suggests to me you might be feeding URIs into the crawler in a way
> that doesn't match your intent (if an "F+" line of that format was being
> considered at that time).

I think you are correct about feeding URIs into the crawler. When I am 
converting the diverted files to .schedule format, I think that my 
script is not always converting the entries correctly.  I am trying to 
debug that now.

> To refresh my memory and for reference, what is your OS/JVM?
>
